entities: Security Council Working Group on Peacekeeping Operations
reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports to the Council on individual peacekeeping operations; assessments meetings with interested delegations, in particular troop-contributing countries, at appropriate stages of each peacekeeping operation
summary:
**Consultation Meetings with Troop-Contributing Countries**

* Consultation meetings will continue as the principal means of consultation, convened and chaired by the President of the Security Council.
* Meetings may be convened at different stages of peacekeeping operations, including mission planning, changes to the mandate, renewal of mandate, and significant developments.
* Invitees to these meetings include:
	+ Troop-contributing countries
	+ Prospective troop-contributing countries
	+ Relevant UN bodies and agencies
	+ Other bodies and agencies as observers
	+ Countries making special contributions
	+ Host country/countries as observers
	+ Regional or subregional organizations contributing troops
* Meetings will consider:
	+ Preparations for peacekeeping mandates
	+ Operational issues
	+ Secretary-General's concerns and recommendations
	+ Specific concerns of troop-contributing countries
	+ Progress in mission tasks

**Improving Quality and Effectiveness of Consultations**

* An informal paper setting out the agenda will be circulated to participants.
* The Secretary-General will ensure reports are issued in good time to allow timely meetings with troop-contributing countries.
* Fact sheets will be made available to all participants.
* Briefings will be given by senior personnel working with the mission in the field, where possible.
The Security Council makes the following arrangements for communication and consultation:

The Secretary-General should provide objective assessments and analyses of political, military, humanitarian, and human rights situations in briefings, making them more user-friendly through information technology.

To ensure timely communication of troop-contributing countries' concerns and views to the Security Council:

* The President of the Security Council will prepare a summary of consultation meetings with troop-contributing countries, assisted by the Secretariat.
* The summary will be distributed to Council members before informal consultations or the next meeting on the relevant peacekeeping operation.

The Security Council supports meetings between the Secretariat and troop-contributing countries, with participation of Special Representatives, Force Commanders, and Civilian Police Commissioners, where appropriate.
